intro: Chamaesyce ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in rocky soils and dry environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are oval-shaped, fleshy, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Chamaesyce ovalifolia plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
